decision_conditions:
<p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 0cm; margin-top: 0cm; line-height: normal;">The proposed rear
extension, by reason of scale, resultant height, massing and siting in close
proximity to No. 149 Eastcote Lane would lead to an overbearing and
overshadowing of the neighbouring property, to the detriment of the residential
and visual amenities of the occupiers, contrary to the National Planning Policy
Framework (2023), policy D3. D (7) of the London Plan (2021), policy DM 1 of
the Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013) and the adopted
Supplementary Planning Document: Residential Design Guide (2010)<font face="Arial, sans-serif"><span style="font-size: 12pt;"><o:p></o:p></span></font></p>

<p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 0cm; margin-top: 0cm; line-height: normal;">The proposed rear
extension taken in combination with the two storey front extension would, by
reason of inappropriate design and scale would result in a bulky and
incongruous form of development which would be harmful to the character and
appearance of the original dwellinghouse and streetscene by reason of
overdevelopment failing to adhere to the high quality design aspirations of the
National Planning Policy Framework (2023), Policy D3 (D(1) and (11)) of The
London Plan (2021), Core Policy CS1.B of the Harrow Core Strategy (2012),
Policy DM1 A, DM1 B (a), (b) and (c) of the Harrow Development Management
Policies Local Plan (2013) and the adopted Supplementary Planning Document:
Residential Design Guide (2010).&nbsp;<font face="Arial, sans-serif"><span style="font-size: 12pt;"><o:p></o:p></span></font></p>
description: Two storey front extension and Single Storey rear extension
